Class WordPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordPool

  • public class WordPool
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a flyweight pool of words. This is effectively a collection of singletons, one for each word. Each word is referenced by a link. A sentence, for example, is therefore represented as an ordered list is links, each of which points to a word in the word pool.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordPool()
      Creates an empty pool.

    • Method Detail

      • addWord

        public Link addWord(Word word)
        Adds a word to the pool. Multiple calls to this method do not add it again.
        Parameters:
        word - - the word
        Returns:
        the link pointing to this word. It is always the same, regardless of whether the word was newly added or already present

      • getLinks

        public java.util.List<Link> getLinks()
        Gets the links for the words in the pool in no particular order.
        Returns:
        the links

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Gets the number of words in the pool.
        Returns:
        the count

      • getWord

        public Word getWord(Link link)
        Gets a word in the pool.
        Parameters:
        link - - the link to the word
        Returns:
        the word
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if link points to an unknown word or is not alive

      • getWords

        public java.util.List<Word> getWords()
        Gets the words in the pool in no particular order.
        Returns:
        the words

      • hasLink

        public boolean hasLink(Link link)
        Gets whether a link points to a word in the pool.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the state

      • hasWord

        Gets whether a word is in the pool.

      • removeWord

        public Word removeWord(Link link)
        Removes a word from the pool and kills the link.
        Parameters:
        link - - the link to the word
        Returns:
        the removed word
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if link points to an unknown word or is not alive
        See Also:
        Link.kill()
